docs.text:
MC² Project


Authors
Jun Zheng (junthehacker), Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
Welcome to the documentation for the MC² Project, a collaborative math equation editing software.


Installation and Setup Requirements


You must have the following installed:




npm


Node.js


MongoDB




Running the Application Locally




Download the source code at 
https://github.com/bestlkh/ice-MC2
.


Run 
npm install
.


Start MongoDB.


Run 
npm start
.


Go to 
http://localhost:8080
.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Authors Jun Zheng (junthehacker), Daniel Hugh (hughdani) Welcome to the documentation for the MC² Project, a collaborative math equation editing software.
docs.title: MC² Project

docs.text: You must have the following installed:   npm  Node.js  MongoDB
docs.title: Installation and Setup Requirements

docs.text: Download the source code at  https://github.com/bestlkh/ice-MC2 .  Run  npm install .  Start MongoDB.  Run  npm start .  Go to  http://localhost:8080 .
docs.title: Running the Application Locally

docs.text:
Authors
Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
How to Create a New Room




Select 
Create Room
.


Enter a username and a room name.


Choose an avatar from the set of themes.


Click 
Create
 to create and join the room.




How to Join an Existing Room




Select 
Join Room
.


Enter a username and an existing room name.


Choose an avatar from the set of themes.


Click 
Login
 to join the room.




Joining a Private Room




Enter the URL provided by the room owner.


Enter a username to join the room.


Click 
Start
 to join the room.






Tip


Administrators can login with their credentials.
docs.title: Login

docs.text: Select  Create Room .  Enter a username and a room name.  Choose an avatar from the set of themes.  Click  Create  to create and join the room.
docs.title: How to Create a New Room

docs.text: Select  Join Room .  Enter a username and an existing room name.  Choose an avatar from the set of themes.  Click  Login  to join the room.
docs.title: How to Join an Existing Room

docs.text: Enter the URL provided by the room owner.  Enter a username to join the room.  Click  Start  to join the room.    Tip  Administrators can login with their credentials.
docs.title: Joining a Private Room

docs.text:
Authors
Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
How to Send Text Messages




Enter text into the message box.


Click 
Send
.




How to Send LaTeX Messages




Click the 
TeX
 icon to access the LaTeX Editor.


Enter your LaTeX expression.


Prepend and append 
$$
 to your LaTeX.


Click 
Send
.




How to Import Images to Chat




Click the 
Image
 icon.


Select the file you wish to upload.
 




Chat Menu Options


How to Display All Online Users




Click the 
Chat Options
 tab to expand the options.


Click the 
Online Users
 button.




How to Logout




Click the 
Chat Options
 tab to expand the options.


Click the 
Logout
 button.




Message Options


Text Messages


How to Copy a Message to the Chat




Click on a message that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Pencil
 icon to copy the contents to the message textbox.




How to View Message Details




Click on a message that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Ellipsis
 to open a window containing message details.




LaTeX Messages


How to View LaTeX Details




Click on an equation that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Ellipsis
 to open a window containing equation details.




How to Copy LaTeX




Click on an equation that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Pencil
 icon.






LaTeX Destination


The equation will appear in your math editor or chat textbox depending on the origin of the equation.




How to View the LaTeX Source




Click on an equation that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
/
 icon.


A window containing the source will appear.




Images


How to Change Magnification of Images




Click on an image that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Magnification Glass
 icon.


Use the 
Plus/Minus Magnification Glass
 icons to zoom.




How to View Image Details




Click on an image that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Ellipsis
 to open a window containing image details.




How to Copy an Image from the Chat to the Math Editor




Click on a image that has been sent to chat.


Click the 
Pencil
 icon to make the image appear in the math editor.

docs.text:
Authors
Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
How to Import Images from the Editor




Click the 
Edit
 menu item.


Click on 
Import Image
.


Select the image to be imported.




How to Select Items




Select the 
Select Tool
.


Click and drag to select an area.




How to Draw Freehand on the Canvas




Select the 
Pencil Tool
.


Click on the canvas to start drawing.




How to Zoom In on the Canvas (Desktop)




Select the 
Zoom In Tool
.


Click the canvas to zoom in.




How to Zoom Out on the Canvas (Desktop)




Select the 
Zoom Out Tool
.


Click the canvas to zoom out.




How to Input Symbols (Desktop)




Select the 
Shape Library Tool
.


A keyboard containing mathematical symbols and characters will now be available.


Click a symbol to add it to the canvas.




How to Delete Items on the Canvas




Use the 
Select Tool
 to highlight the area to delete. The highlighted area will be coloured red.


Click the 
Delete
 icon 




How to Convert Symbols into LaTeX (Desktop)




Select the 
Convert Tool
.


Check the preview to ensure that the correct expression is created.






Tip


Click 
Send to Chat
 if you want to send the expression to the chat.




How to Convert Symbols into LaTeX (Mobile)




Click the 
Convert and Send
 icon.


Then click 
Send as Equation
 to send the contents to the chatroom.




How to Send LaTeX Expressions (Desktop)




Navigate to the math editor.


Write LaTeX into the text space.


Prepend and append 
$$
 symbols to the LaTeX.


Click 
Send to Chat
 to send the equation to the chat.






Tip


You can check the preview to verify the contents before sending.




How to Send LaTeX Expressions (Mobile)




Click the 
TeX
 icon.


Write LaTeX into the text space.


Prepend and append 
$$
 symbols to the LaTeX


Click 
Send
 to send the equation to the chat.




How to Send Contents on the Canvas as an Image to Chat (Desktop)




Click the 
Send as Image
 icon.


The current state of your canvas will be automatically sent to the chat.




How to Send Contents on the Canvas as an Image to Chat (Mobile)




Click 
Convert and Send
 icon.


Click 
Send as Image
.




How to Resize the Interface (Desktop)




Click and drag the vertical bar partitioning the math editor and the chat.


Drag the vertical bar to partition the math editor space to your preference




How to Configure the View (Desktop)




Click the 
Right Arrow
 to make the math editor take up the entire view.


Click the 
Left Arrow
 to reset the partitioning to its default to include the chat.

.

docs.text:
Authors
Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
How to Create a Classroom




After logging in, click the 
Create Classroom
 button.


Enter a label for the class and the classroom name.


Choose whether this room will require an invite.


Click 
Submit
.




How to Delete a Classroom




Select a classroom.


Click 
Delete
.




How to Connect to a Classroom




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Connect
.




How to View Classroom Details




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.




How to View All Classrooms




Click on the 
Classrooms
 tab.




How to Change Classroom Name




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click 
Change
 on the room name.


Click 
Save
.




How to Change Classroom Invite Settings




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Toggle the 
Invite Only
 slider.


Click 
Save
.






Invite Only Setting


Users will require a URL containing a token to be able to access an Invite Only room.




How to Add Individual Students to the Classroom




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
Students
 tab.


Click 
Add Item
.


Enter their utorid and email.


Click 
Submit
.






Tokens


User tokens for invite only rooms are generated here.




How to Add Students using CSV




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
Students
 tab.


Click 
Import
.


Follow the instructions to upload a CSV file.


Click 
Submit
.




How to Export Student Details as CSV




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
Students
 tab.


Click 
Export
 to download the CSV file.




How to Search for a Classroom




Enter the classroom into the search bar.




How to Search for a Student




Click the 
Classrooms
 tab.


Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
Students
 tab.


Enter the student’s name into the search bar.




How to Reset Student Tokens




Click on the 
Classrooms
 tab.


Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click on the 
Students
 tab.


Click 
Reset
.






After Resetting


Users who are still logged in with an old token still have access to the room until they logout.




How to view Chat History




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
History
 tab.


Select 
Messages
.






Tip


Use the search bar to filter results.




How to View User Statistics




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
History
 tab.


Select 
Students
.






Tip


Use the search bar to filter results.




How to Export Data for a Specific Session as CSV




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
History
 tab.


Select the session to export from the left column.


Click 
Export
.




How to Export Data for All Sessions as CSV




Click on an existing classroom.


Click 
Details
.


Click the 
History
 tab.


Click 
Export All Sesssions
.

 icon to remove the message.

docs.text:
Developer Documentation


Authors
Jun Zheng (junthehacker), Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
This documentation is aimed to provide developers a better understanding of the project. It also includes some very important API documentation.


Requirements


You must have the following installed:




npm


Node.js


MongoDB




Running the Application Locally




Download the source code at 
https://github.com/bestlkh/ice-MC2
.


Run 
npm install
.


Start MongoDB.


Run 
npm run dev
.






Windows Developers


Instead run 
node app.js 
 gulp dev
. To fully exit from the application, you will need to kill the background task 
node app.js
.




This will start up a development server that will watch for file changes. A browser window will open to the default server hosted on 
http://localhost:3000
.


Project Layout


+ AdminView/       - Self explaintory
+ public/          - Everything that will be served with Node.js
| ---+ app/        - Controllers, libs etc.
| ---|---+ dist/   - Gulp
s destination for compiled files 
| ---+ docs-src/   - Documentation source
| ---+ docs/       - Compiled documentation
| ---+ landing/    - Landing page
| ---+ lib/        - External libs
| ---+ login/      - Login page
| ---+ register/   - Register page
| ---+ index.html  - Angular enterence point
+ app.js           - Primary Node.js script
+ gulp.js          - Gulp task file
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: Authors Jun Zheng (junthehacker), Daniel Hugh (hughdani) This documentation is aimed to provide developers a better understanding of the project. It also includes some very important API documentation.

To fully exit from the application, you will need to kill the background task  node app.js .   This will start up a development server that will watch for file changes. A browser window will open to the default server hosted on  http://localhost:3000 .

+ gulp.js          - Gulp task file

docs.text:
Authors
Daniel Hugh (hughdani)
Most of the Gulp scripts have been abstracted to npm's script runner. However you can directly leverage Gulp to run and create new tasks. This can be done by through the 
gulp.js
 file. 


Tasks


gulp dev


Starts up a development server at 
localhost:3000
 (by default). It then begins a clean compilation of necessary files and starts watchers for HTML, LESS and JavaScript files.


gulp deploy


Compiles necessary files for deployment.


gulp styles


Recompiles LESS files into CSS.


gulp scripts


Bundle and transpile JavaScript files listed in the 
JS_FILES
 array. Source maps are generated.


gulp compile


Compilation for development. Combintation of 
gulp styles
 and 
gulp scripts


gulp scripts-dist


gulp scripts
 with minification and without source maps.


gulp styles-dist


gulp styles
 with minification.


gulp compile-dist


Compilation for deployment. Combintation of 
gulp styles-dist
 and 
gulp scripts-dist
.


gulp clean


Removes all compiled LESS and JavaScript files.
docs.title: Build Tools

docs.title: gulp styles

docs.title: gulp scripts

docs.text: Compilation for development. Combintation of  gulp styles  and  gulp scripts

docs.text: gulp scripts  with minification and without source maps.

docs.text: gulp styles  with minification.
docs.title: gulp styles-dist

docs.title: gulp compile-dist

docs.text: Removes all compiled LESS and JavaScript files.

docs.text:
Authors
Jun Zheng (junthehacker)


Note


Dependencies
: jQuery Full Version




UI Library is aimed to provide developers a better platform to write controls for MC^2 project.


The library has two main parts: 
controls
 and 
events
.


controls
 is where all controls resides, for example: 
Button
, 
Toolbar
 etc.


events
 is where all custom events resides, for example: 
ControlClickEvent
, 
ControlValueChangeEvent
 etc.


Controls




BasicControl
docs.title: Overview

docs.title: Controls

docs.text:
Alert Library Overview


/ 
Home
 / Alert Library


Authors
Jun Zheng (junthehacker)
Dependencies
Alertify.js CSS Theme
Alertify is bundled with this plugin.
Alert library provides some alert functionality that extends the default 
alert
 and 
prompt
.


Alert library is loaded in 
index.html
 by default, but you can simply link the 
alert.bundle.js
 to include in your page. All classes are attatched to 
window.Alert
.


Get Started


Display Alert


var
 
my_alert
 
=
 
new
 
Alert
.
Alert
(
Title
,
 
Message
,
 
function
(){

   
// What happens if user press ok. 


});


my_alert
.
show
();






Display Alert Without 
new


Alert
.
Alert
.
spawn
(
Title
,
 
Message
,
 
function
(){

   
// What happens if user press ok 


});






Notifications are the same, just use 
Alert.Notification
, for more information, checkout the detailed class doc.


Classes


Dialogs




Alert




Overlays




Notification
docs.title: Overview

Alert library is loaded in  index.html  by default, but you can simply link the  alert.bundle.js  to include in your page. All classes are attatched to  window.Alert .

docs.text:
Message Format


/ 
Home
 / Message Format


Authors
Jun Zheng (junthehacker)
All messages in the chat are sent by plain text. But there are many advanced message types that you may want to use.


You can simply use Message class to auto generate the following text format. This is just for reference.


Regular Text


Simply send the message as plain text.


Format


This is just a message





Image


Image message types are prefixed with 
[mc2-image]
, and followed by base64 encoding of that image.


Format


[mc2-image] data:image/jpeg;base64,





Base64 string must indicate mime type.


Attachments


Messages can have attachments.


To attach extra data, simply append 
\n-----MC2 BEGIN ATTACHMENT-----\n
 to your message.


Then append base64 encoding of the following JSON data.


Then append 
\n-----MC2 END ATTACHMENT-----\n


{

  
attachment-name
:
 
data


}






For example:


This is just a simple text message
-----MC2 BEGIN ATTACHMENT-----
eyJhdHRhY2htZW50LW5hbWUiOiAiZGF0YSJ9
-----MC2 END ATTACHMENT-----





SVG Source


With SVG source, user can put the message back to editor.


{

  
svg-source
:
 
SVG Source in base64, no mime


}
docs.title: Message Format

docs.text: /  Home  / Message Format  Authors Jun Zheng (junthehacker) All messages in the chat are sent by plain text. But there are many advanced message types that you may want to use.  You can simply use Message class to auto generate the following text format. This is just for reference.
docs.title: Message Format

docs.text: Simply send the message as plain text.  Format  This is just a message
docs.title: Regular Text

docs.text: Image message types are prefixed with  [mc2-image] , and followed by base64 encoding of that image.  Format  [mc2-image] data:image/jpeg;base64,  Base64 string must indicate mime type.
docs.title: Image

docs.text:
Messages can have attachments.  To attach extra data, simply append  \n-----MC2 BEGIN ATTACHMENT-----\n  to your message.  Then append base64 encoding of the following JSON data.  Then append  \n-----MC2 END ATTACHMENT-----\n  { 
   attachment-name :   data  }   For example:  This is just a simple text message
-----MC2 BEGIN ATTACHMENT-----
eyJhdHRhY2htZW50LW5hbWUiOiAiZGF0YSJ9
-----MC2 END ATTACHMENT-----
docs.title: Attachments

docs.text:
With SVG source, user can put the message back to editor.  { 
   svg-source :   SVG Source in base64, no mime  }
docs.title: SVG Source

Authors
Jun Zheng (junthehacker)
Basic control class, this is the parent class for most controls.


Mostly useless by itself.


Properties

The dom element this control is attatched to.

get
 
set

When using the setter, it will automatically run jQuery show or hide method on dom.

get
 
set
 
_preventDefaultClick


If true, onClick event will prevent system default click event.

(

)

=

ui
.

(

(

));






set
 
onClick
(

(
e
){

    
console
.
log
(

);

The constructor,

my_alert
 
=
 
new

.

(

,

,

(){

()

spawn
(

,

,
 
callback
)


Spawn an anonymous alert instance.


The usage is same as constructor, this method does not return anything.
